trans-unit.source: Represents the contents of the optional `Subcode` element of a SOAP fault when SOAP version 1.2 is used to communicate between a client and an XML Web service.
A SOAP 1.2 fault contains a `Code` element and among other things an optional `Subcode` element.

The `Code` element specifies the type of error that occurred using a limited number of pre-defined error codes specified by the SOAP protocol, whereas the `Subcode` element allows the sender of the SOAP fault to provide an application specific error code.
This class represents the contents of the `Subcode` element.

XML Web services return a SOAP fault by throwing a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException>, and .NET clients receive a SOAP fault by catching a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException>.

A <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException> has a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.Code%2A> property that represents the `Code` element and a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException.SubCode%2A> property that represents the `Subcode` element.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode"></xref> class and sets the application specific error code.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> specifying the application specific error code.
Sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode.Code"></xref> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode"></xref> class setting the application specific error code and additional error information.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> specifying the application specific error code.
Sets the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode.Code"></xref> property.
Gets the application specific error code in the form of an XML qualified name.
Use a constructor to set the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode.Code%2A> property.

The value of the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode.Code%2A> property can be any user defined XML qualified name, including the codes represented by the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.Soap12FaultCodes.RpcProcedureNotPresentFaultCode?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.Soap12FaultCodes.RpcBadArgumentsFaultCode?displayProperty=fullName>, <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.Soap12FaultCodes.EncodingMissingIdFaultCode?displayProperty=fullName>, and <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.Soap12FaultCodes.EncodingUntypedValueFaultCode?displayProperty=fullName> fields.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> representing the application specific error code.
Gets additional error information contained within a child `Subcode` element.
Use a constructor to set the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode.SubCode%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode.SubCode%2A> property allows an XML Web service to provide nested error information.
This is useful for providing an error code specific to the XML Web service while passing along error information returned from components the XML Web service called.
A <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapFaultSubCode"></xref> containing additional error information.
